> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > " So will I. Talon, so will I. But =
that doesn't mean we can't try to recreate a little portion of life on our =
own planet. This seed we were given, it needs soil, water, light and someth=
ing to plant it in. Perhaps we can find a place where there is an abundance=
 of soil and take that with us. "
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Just as he s=
poke, a Protohuman, carrying an offering of fish, kneels down before Tucson=
 and Talon. Tucson looks to the offering. It was a most generous portion of=
 fish. Yet now he could not eat it, but he knew Talon would need nourishmen=
t. He nods gently to the Protohuman and accepts his offering with a gentile=
 touch of his nose on the man's shoulder. He allows him to stroke his snout=
 as some sort of good luck ritual. The man bows in graciousness to Tucson's=
 gesture of kindness and leaves him be with Talon.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > >=
 > > " I'm not so sure what all of that meant but, whatever it was, it was =
a very kind gesture on his part. I wonder if these people had any interacti=
on with the old Silver Dragon.. " 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > It isn't lo=
ng before others come to offer more gifts to him and Talon. One of the Prot=
ohumans points to a painting on a rock, with white portraying silver, in a =
primitive image of a large reptile with outstretched wings.
> > > > > > > 
=
> > > > > > > " Oh, I see now.. Yes, they have seen him before. To them he =
is a guardian, and the more offerings they gave him, he would return their =
kind gestures by offering his protection. But there is more to these painti=
ngs.. A strange mysterious figure, with an aura around it.. To me it seems =
evil. Another idol, someone else to worship. .. People portrayed in black a=
nd white.. White, meaning those who look to the Silver Dragon and black to =
those who worship the intimidating idol.. I've seen ancient pictographs bef=
ore on Cybertron, and these are different but in the same format. Talon if =
the dragon is a physical being, then this dark idol must be as well. We nee=
d to find it, before it lays harm to anyone."

> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >=
 > With a gentile smile, Tucson returns the kiss and holds his wing over th=
em to provide a moment alone with Talon. After the kiss he lowers his wing =
and notices that a collection of small creatures surrounding him and Talon =
. Yet they do so in a fashion of admiration rather than hostility. Tucson l=
ooks to them curiously.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > " I'm not sure=
 why these creatures are curious about us but it appears as if they're here=
 to admire rather than attack. I wonder... "
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > >=
 > > > He stands up and gets back into beast mode, and sits down once more.=
 The creatures draw closer to him and sit beside him and Talon. It was clea=
r that the Silver Dragon was a source of comfort to these creatures, but th=
at was about to change once he and Talon left for Cybertron. It was a massi=
ve guilt slammed upon his heart. Yet how could he get the animals to unders=
tand that he had to leave them in such a short time? He was now their guard=
ian and they were looking up to him for protection. 
> > > > > > > > > 
> >=
 > > > > > > > " Talon, these creatures remember the old dragon that sought=
 to their protection and realize that I have taken his place. It's as I tho=
ught, they aren't aware of who we really are, and where we are from. They w=
ill not understand that we must leave them shortly, for good, and Primus kn=
ows what will happen to them once we leave. ... Talon, I hear something com=
ing. It's not a Predacon but it's a fairly large creature."
> > > > > > > >=
 > 
> > > > > > > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots the scales of a rathe=
r large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream next to them. He =
watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lifts its head. It was=
 another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than he was, but the same c=
oloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was female. She looks to =
him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and they look gently to e=
ach other like brother and sister. In draconic vocalization, Tucson explain=
s who he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back and bows her head. She=
 nods as he does. It was their way of communicating as Tucson looks back to=
 Talon.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > " Apparently the old dragon ha=
s family here. They are scattered but they exist. And she said that she wil=
l protect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for as long=
 as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our journey."
> > > > > > > >=
 > 
> > > > > > > > > With that, the dragoness leaves them peacefully to en=
joy their time together. With a gentile groan, the creatures too, depart. I=
t was truly a spiritual moment for both of them.

n holds Talon gently with an arm around her shoulders. He looks up and then=
 back to her.

> > > > > > > > > > > " Like a branch =
on a tree that has broken off during a storm and regrows in a different dir=
ection than it had been, before it had broken off. I know exactly how you f=
eel. I feel the same way. At one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels a=
nd I always seemed to be an Autobot rebel. I fought along side with my comr=
ades but I wasn't good at following orders. I was well grounded but lost at=
 the same time. Then, I met you and things began to change on a more positi=
ve note. You may not believe this, but you helped me to find my path, and y=
ou saw me on the right road and guided me to my true fate. Soon afterwards,=
 I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like O=
ptimus Prime, yet different. But one thing didn't change, I was still battl=
ing blindness off and on. Then, a third change, due to extensive damage to =
my previous form, which could not be repaired, I was guided to my final evo=
lution, this one. All of these things wouldn't have come about if I had nev=
er met you. And I wouldn't have it any other way. Talon, I will miss this p=
lanet as much as you are, and hopefully we can tell our offspring all about=
 this planet and it's wondrous varieties of life that live here."
